alert.note: Alert for Grand and Summit Counties Below 9000 Feet; Jackson County Below 9000 Feet; Larimer and Boulder Counties Between 6000 and 9000 Feet; South and East Jackson, Larimer, North and Northeast Grand, Northwest Boulder Counties Above 9000 Feet (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 04 at 2:45PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...Strong gusty winds with showers will impact portions of eastern Jackson, northwestern Larimer and northwestern Grand Counties through 315 PM MDT... At 243 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a line of showers producing wind gusts up to 55 mph along a line extending from 8 miles south of Hutton Lake to 13 miles north of Parshall, or along a line extending from 20 miles southwest of Laramie to 70 miles east of Craig. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Walden, Kinikinik, Chambers Lake, Rand, Cameron Pass, Four Corners, Gould, Glendevey, and Red Feather Lakes. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: Prepare for sudden gusty winds. Secure loose objects and move to a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. Persons in campgrounds or near lakes should consider seeking sturdy shelter until these storms pass.
